text: Larissa Iapichino (born 18 July 2002) is an Italian female long jumper who won gold medal at the 2019 European Athletics U20 Championships. At under-20 level her personal best, 6.80 m, is the 5th best world performance of 2020 and 2nd all-time in Italy lists at senior level, 4th all time U20 world wide at first year of category ==Biography== She is the daughter of former pole vaulter Gianni Iapichino and former long jumper Fiona May. ==National records== * Long jump under-20: 6.80 m – Savona, 16 July 2020 * Long jump under-20 indoor: 6.40 m - Ancona ==Achievements== {| class="wikitable" width=55% style="font- size:90%; text-align:center;" |- !Year !!Competition !!Venue !!Position !!Event!!Measure!!Notes |- |2019 |align=left|European U20 Championships |align=left| Borås |bgcolor=gold|1st |Long jump |6.58 m | |} ==National titles== *Italian Athletics Championships **Long jump: 2020 ==Personal bests== *Long jump: 6.80 m – Savona, 16 July 2020 ==See also== * Italian all-time lists - Long jump ==References== ==External links== * * Larissa Iapichino at FIDAL Category:2002 births Category:Living people Category:Italian female long jumpers
title: Larissa Iapichino
